title: Secretary / Admin and Human Resources Personnel Job at D&M Data Solutions
content:
D&M Data Solutions is a growing group of small businesses in Nigeria with a bold vision to become a key player across major industries. We are beginning our journey in the food processing and agricultural sectors, with plans to expand into other industries in the near future.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Secretary / Admin and Human Resources Personnel

Job Location: Sango-Ota, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: Food Processing / Farming

Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a dedicated and organized Secretary / Human Resource Officer to support our day-to-day operations.
	This is a dual-role position ideal for someone who can manage administrative tasks and oversee basic HR functions in a small business setting.


Key Responsibilities
Administrative & Secretarial Duties:


	Manage office correspondence, calls, and visitor inquiries.
	Schedule meetings and maintain management calendars.
	Prepare letters, reports, memos, and other documents.
	Organize and maintain filing systems (physical and digital).
	Track office supplies and support general office logistics.


Human Resource Functions:


	Assist with staff recruitment, onboarding, and documentation.
	Maintain up-to-date employee records and HR files.
	Monitor staff attendance and leave records.
	Assist in payroll preparation and timesheet management.
	Support staff performance tracking and basic conflict resolution.
	Help enforce company policies and improve workplace discipline.


Requirements


	OND, HND, or B.Sc Degree in Business Admin, HR, or related fields
	Minimum of 2 years of experience in a similar role.
	Proficient in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, Outlook).
	Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
	Must be organized, reliable, and able to work with minimal supervision.
	Knowledge of basic HR practices and Nigerian labor regulations is a plus.
	Candidate must reside in or around Sango-Ota, Ogun State, candidates in close proximity to Sango Ota shall be considered.


Why Join Us?


	Remuneration: N150,000 monthly.
	At D&M Data Solutions, you’ll be part of a visionary and dynamic team with a passion for innovation and excellence. As we grow and diversify our operations, you’ll have the opportunity to grow with us, contribute meaningfully, and make your mark in a fast-evolving business environment.


Method of Application
Interested and qualfiied candidates should send their CV and a brief cover letter to: d.m.datasolutions1@gmail.com or davidolupitan@yahoo.com using "Secretary / Admin - Bakery / Sachet Water Operations" as the subject of the mail.

Note: Qualified candidates shall be interviewed immediately.

title: Store Supervisor Job at Kinz Global Consult
content:

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Store Supervisor

title: Job Vacancies at Cen Global Services Limited
content:
Cen Global Services Limited (“Cen Global”) is proudly a Nigerian registered company with broad specialization in Shipping & Marine, Recruitment & Manpower Supply, Procurement & Engineering Services, and Consultancy Services. Cen Global was incorporated in March, 2010.

Our business sustainable approach is to understand the needs of our clients and subsequently create a uniquely structured service process tailored towards meeting or exceeding expectations.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Learning and Development Coordinator

Job Location: Port Harcourt - Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a proactive and resourceful Learning and Development Officer to support the design, coordination, and delivery of impactful training programs.
	The ideal candidate will play a critical role in improving employee performance, enhancing client satisfaction, and promoting a culture of continuous learning within and outside the organization.


Key Responsibilities


	Support implementation of HR strategies and initiatives
	Conduct training needs assessments in collaboration with clients and internal stakeholders.
	Design, plan, and implement learning and development initiatives, including induction, soft skills, technical, compliance, and leadership training.
	Liaise with subject matter experts and external facilitators to ensure high-quality training delivery.
	Evaluate the effectiveness of training programs using feedback, assessments, and performance outcomes.
	Maintain training records, reports, and documentation in line with company standards.
	Ensure all training programs comply with relevant regulatory and quality assurance standards.


Requirements and Qualifications


	A Bachelor’s Degree in Law, Engineering or a related field
	Strong interpersonal and communication skills
	Knowledge of Nigerian labour laws and HR best practices
	Professional certification (e.g., CIPM) is an added advantage
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.


Application Closing Date: 2nd July, 2025. 

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their resumes to: careers@cenglobalservices.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

 

2.) Human Resources Officer

Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are looking for a smart and resourceful Human Resources Officer to join our team. 
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for implementing HR strategies, managing employee relations, coordinating recruitment, and overseeing learning and development initiatives.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and implement HR strategies, policies, and procedures
	Manage end-to-end recruitment and selection processes
	Maintain employee records and HR documentation
	Coordinate and manage training and development programs
	Ensure compliance with the labour laws and internal HR policies

Qualifications and Requirements


	A good University degree.
	A Bachelor’s Degree in law or engineering is an added advantage
	Strong interpersonal and communication skills
	Knowledge of Nigerian labour laws and HR best practices
	Professional certification (e.g., CIPM) is an added advantage.


Application Closing Date: 10th July, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their resumes to: careers@cenglobalservices.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

 

3.) Legal Secretary

Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary


	We are seeking a highly organized and detail-oriented Legal Secretary for our client in Port Harcourt.
	The ideal candidate will provide efficient and confidential secretarial services, ensure timely document preparation, and maintain the smooth operation of legal procedures.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop legal documents including contracts, agreements, memos, letters, and court filings.
	Manage meetings, and organize legal appointments.
	Maintain accurate and up-to-date filing systems for legal documents, case files, and correspondence.

	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills.


Application Closing Date: 18th June, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their resumes to: careers@cenglobalservices.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

title: Job Openings at TechnoServe
content:
TechnoServe works with enterprising people in the developing world to build competitive farms, businesses, and industries. We are a non-profit organization that develops business solutions to poverty by linking people to information, capital, and markets. Our work is rooted in the idea that given the opportunity, hardworking men and women in even the poorest places can generate income, jobs, and wealth for their families and communities. With more than four decades of proven results, we believe in the power of private enterprise to transform lives.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Project Administrator, PReP & SAYWEE
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Requisition Number: PROJE004904
Job Location: Lagos
Job Type: Full-Time / On-site
Job Category: Operations
Project: Plastics Recycling Program in Southern Nigeria (PReP) and Skilling Adolescents and Young Women for Entrepreneurship and Employability (SAY-WEE)
Reports to: Senior Project Manager

Job Summary


	TechnoServe seeks a highly organized, detail-oriented professional to assist with administrative and logistics functions for the PReP & SAYWEE projects.
	The role is a critical function of the state offices and ensures smooth office operations at all times. 


Program/Practice/Department Overview


	The Project Administrator will be part of the Operations department to support activities across Anambra and Lagos states for the project team through the following:. 


Primary Functions & Responsibilities
Travel and Logistics:


	Assist with international and domestic travel requests for all staff.
	As assigned, process all visa and work permit requests for staff in compliance with host Country guidelines.
	Guide other office support staff, such as drivers and cleaners, to regularly comply with operational standards.
	Work with the Operations Specialists of the project to coordinate paperwork and physical maintenance of the fleet and logistics management.
	Work with Operations Specialists to check vehicle routes and speed limit applications.


Office Management:


	Inspect and track usage of office consumables and its facilities, including utilities such as diesel, generator maintenance, electricity and other health and safety regulators.
	Drafting of reports relating to the state offices.
	Collection of fuel purchase invoices at the state offices for transmission to the finance department.
	Executes daily purchases and manages office petty cash.
	Provide petty cash vouchers and payment of petty cash expenses.
	Submit monthly Petty cash fund reconciliation with all related documents.
	Draft correspondence, including reports, processes, and other administrative documents.
	Assumes responsibility for document filing and applies initiative in developing office administrative procedures.


Procurement:


	Work with the Operations Specialists of the project to coordinate the project's needs and make the requests in the system.


Basic Qualifications
These are the requirements that any qualified candidate must meet. Typically includes:


	Bachelor’s Degree or Tertiary studies in Business Administration, Public Administration, Sociology, Office Management, or other relevant social sciences-related fields
	Procurement certification or prior experience is an added advantage.


Preferred Qualification:


	Alternatively, have at least 2 years of work experience in an administrative / office management role, with responsibilities related to procurement, preferably with an international NGO. 


Travel:


	Ability to travel on occasion.      


Language Requirement:


	Fluency in English, both in writing and speaking.


Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:


	Effective oral and written communication skills, and the ability to work independently on multiple tasks simultaneously 
	Strong interpersonal, organizational, and communication skills
	Experience with relevant software packages is useful for preparing relevant work documents.
	High Professional work ethic and integrity. 
	Ability to reason objectively, clear, strong and strategic communication skills.
	Good interpersonal and public relations skills.
	Strong operational, analytical and management skills.
	Ability to multitask competing priorities with minimal supervision.
	Ability to work both as a team lead and a team member.


Click here to apply online

 

 

2.) Business Advisor (PRiFN)

Requisition Number: BUSIN004952
Job Location: Kano
Job Type: Full-Time / On-site
Job Category: Programs
Project: Promoting Rice Fortification in Nigeria (PRiFN) Project
Reports to: Project Manager

Job Summary


	The Business Advisor will work under the supervision of the project manager to provide capacity-building for rice millers, relevant government agencies and other actors in the rice value chain as well as facilitate the linkage of fortified rice produced by the supported rice millers to the school feeding and other social intervention programmes.
	In addition, S/he will gather market intelligence and monitor performance.
	It should be understood that the tasks outlined below are the key responsibilities, but the employee will be expected to perform any tasks that are necessary within the context of the evolving needs of the project.


Program Overview


	TechnoServe, in collaboration with the United Nations World Food Programme (WFP), is implementing the Promoting Rice Fortification in Nigeria (PRiFN) project to pilot and promote the uptake of fortified rice as part of the national strategy to combat micronutrients malnutrition in Nigeria following the approval of the fortification of rice with iron, zinc, folic acid, B12 and other B vitamins by the Federal Government of Nigeria.
	The project aims to support the production of and promote the consumption of fortified rice in Nigeria.


Primary Functions & Responsibilities
Project Inception Phase:


	Take the lead on community sensitization, mobilization and enrollment of rice millers/processors.
	Ensure project targets (including gender) are met.
	Assist the project manager and MEL officer in developing the project work plan, MEAL package and tools.
	Support assessments, baseline, midterm and endline evaluation activities.
	Identify local community trainers in the assigned communities and support the operations team during the recruitment process.


Project Implementation Phase:


	Support the project manager in developing training materials for the production of fortified rice and related food safety and quality control measures.
	Handle the training of rice millers, regulatory agencies, religious and community leaders, as well as other stakeholders key to the implementation of the PRiFN project after development of a proper training design.
	Support community sensitization drives and stakeholder engagement for the promotion of the health benefits of fortified rice.
	Work with the PM in identifying social intervention programs and the integration of fortified rice in them.
	Together with the project manager, identify rice millers/processors and other actors in the rice value chains who would partner with the project.
	Work with the MEL specialist in monitoring and evaluation activities, surveys and reporting as well as developing success stories and lessons learnt.
	Understand, respect and promote Techno Serve’s values, vision, and strategy in the implementation of assigned duties.
	Perform other duties in line with the evolving needs of the program.
	Prepare with the project team for donor reports.


Basic Qualifications


	A Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent in Agronomy, Economics, Human Nutrition, Food Science and Technology, Public Health with a minimum of 2 years’ experience working with rural communities supporting rice farmers. Alternatively, 4 years’ experience.
	Demonstrated understanding of the rice value chain in Nigeria.


 Preferred Qualifications:


	Must have strong interpersonal skills.
	Proven skills with Microsoft Office software (Excel, Word, PowerPoint).
	Excellent communication skills.


Knowledge, skills and abilities


	Ability to engage and advise a broad range of stakeholders, especially community leaders,
	Demonstrated experience in data collection and analyses.
	Demonstrated experience in report writing
	Demonstrated ability to communicate and train in Hausa or other language besides English is an added advantage.


Required Languages: 


	Fluency in English (written and spoken).


Travel: 


	Local/Field Travel.


Click here to apply online

 

 

3.) Women and Youth Manager- PReP

Requisition number: GENDE004999
Job Location: Abuja, Nigeria
Employment Type: Full-Time
Job category: Programs
Reporting Unit/Supervisor: Senior Program Manager

Job Summary


	The Women and Youth Manager will work closely with the PREP program team in Nigeria and in coordination with the Global Women and Youth Practice team to support the delivery of women and youth integration and empowerment activities of the project in the country office.
	This will include technical support to program staff and partners, staff capacity development, direct management of Women and youth integration activities, support to monitoring, reporting, and knowledge management activities, participation in the Women and Youth Champions Network, and overall support to advance TechnoServe’s Women and Youth Equality Policy.


Primary Functions & Responsibilities
Key responsibilities will include:


	Work with the Project staff, develop activities as part of the annual work planning process under each of the project's program areas that address women and youth and youth issues while ensuring that all work plan activities are youth-inclusive and women and youth-sensitive or transformative.
	Collaborate to improve the overall women and youth strategy for Nigeria.
	Provide technical oversight and technical assistance to a portfolio of activities across the project.
	Support the development of women and youth Analysis for the PReP projects that will inform program design and implementation.
	Identify, develop, and support deployment of women and youth- responsive activities to meet the needs of clients. 
	Build local capacity for women and youth integration, and facilitate women and youth-related training for TechnoServe Nigeria staff and partners.
	Be the focal lead in developing and adopting women and youth analysis tools including action plans which assist with the design and implementation of activities and continuously improve technical excellence. 
	Conduct assessments and facilitate meetings, as needed, with key stakeholders and clients to identify measures to improve inclusiveness, especially for women and youth within program interventions.
	Provide strategic guidance and counsel to program leadership and staff on women and youth integration approaches, priorities and compatibility with program aims and resource constraints. 
	Facilitate monitoring of women and youth integration in activities and inclusion in program reports while contributing to reporting on women and youth-related topics.
	Support the development of key knowledge products (e.g., case studies, lessons-learned documents, etc.) that facilitate program development, program implementation, internal knowledge sharing, and support the behavioral change required to achieve the program’s key performance indicators (KPIs).
	Be a major part of staff and consultants’ recruitment and hiring processes on women and youth related elements within various programs.
	Work with the women and youth Practice team to ensure all indicators on the PReP project are being met.
	Participate in regular meetings with program leadership and staff as well as the Global women and youth Practice team. 
	Participate in the women and youth Champions Network.
	Participate in Nigeria women and youth working group.


Basic Qualifications


	A Bachelor’s Degree with at least 7 years’ experience or a Master’s degree with at least 5 years’ experience in Development economics, Sociology, Anthropology, women and youth or related relevant discipline.
	Demonstrable experience implementing practical approaches to advance women and youth and youth equality programs; experience working with donor-funded programs in Nigeria highly preferred.
	Experience and an established relevant network in Nigeria will be considered a plus.
	Demonstrated success in leading tasks, activities, or initiatives requiring a combination of strong analytical, writing, social and management skills.
	Experience implementing approaches to mitigate and reduce women and youth-based violence in economic growth programs will be considered a plus.


Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:


	Experience in adult learning techniques, excellent in-person and virtual facilitation skills.
	Must be able to work across teams to influence behavior and build capacity.
	Ability to work both persuasively and diplomatically in a team-based environment with a high degree of complexity and ambiguity.
	Ability to communicate complex women and youth and youth issues with clarity and precision.
	A deep, demonstrable commitment to women and youth and youth equality and economic empowerment.
	High standards of personal integrity; a commitment to achieving sustainable impact, learning, and teamwork; and excellent sense of humor required.


Required Languages:


	English


Travel:


	In-country travel up to 40%


Click here to apply online

Note


	We encourage all qualified individuals who share TechnoServe's vision of improving the lives of others through proven business solutions to apply.
	With our commitment to diversity, we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and affirmative action employer and do not discriminate on the basis of women and youth, race, color, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, women and youth identity, age, HIV/AIDS status, protected veteran status, disability, and all other protected classes.
	We are also proud of our commitment to protecting staff, partners, and beneficiaries from abuse and exploitation and thoroughly vet all final candidates through rigorous background and reference checks.
	If you have a disability that affects your ability to use our online system to apply for a position at TechnoServe please contact the Human Resources at recruitment@tns.org or call +1 202 785 4515.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

title: Job Openings at Wendernek Consulting Limited
content:
The leading human resource outsourcing management solutions provider in Nigeria. Our purpose is to provide applied and bespoke solutions to our clients.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Administrative Officer

Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Position Decription
Office Reception & Administration:
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Oversee and administer the day-to-day running of the office in accordance with policies, procedures, and systems to ensure productive and efficient office operations.
	Maintain office security by following safety procedures and controlling access via the reception desk.
	Serve as the primary point of administrative contact and liaison with other offices, individuals, and institutions on operational matters of the company.
	Interface and coordinate suppliers and vendors, initiating procurement and ensuring prompt payment and delivery of goods and services.
	Assist with various administrative tasks, such as expense tracking, document preparation, filing, and data entry.
	Code and sort documents so they can be accurately processed or filed.
	Respond to, or redirect, routine inquiries from external or internal sources about the organization, its activities, or processes so callers/visitors are answered promptly and accurately.
	Update calendars and schedule meetings as required.
	Maintain a safe and clean reception area.


Administrative Support and Planning:


	Schedule, organize and coordinate meetings as directed, including meeting space, audio/visual equipment, food/beverage requirements, and administrative support to ensure a successful event.
	Prepare, circulate and maintain the attendance sheet for all meetings.
	Set up, facilitate and attend staff meetings, participate in staff discussions, as appropriate.
	Arrange travel and accommodation, manage agendas, travel plans and appointments for field and other staff as may be required.
	Provide support to the office of the Director Operations in managing his schedule, meetings, official travels, and appointments.
	Take accurate minutes of meetings and distribute them accordingly.
	Set appointments and reminders for the department leadership team.
	Maintains continuity among work teams by documenting and communicating actions plans and/or irregularities.
	Provide secretarial support to the departments (scanning, printing, filing etc).


Assets and Facility Management:


	Assist the Accountant in developing asset management plans for all assets, assessing the need for new purchases, or disposals.
	Assist the Accountant in asset management and disposition of inactive and obsolete assets by tracking inventory, costs, movement, and disposition.
	Maintain and keep asset register(s) of all Company’s Fixed Assets, to include the proper asset numbering, records of the location of assets and persons under whose control or possession each asset is.
	Enter asset data such as hardware serial numbers or identification tags into the Asset Database and ensure information is up-to-date, accurate, and auditable.
	Plan, prioritize, and manage maintenance activities and upgrades to equipment, facilities, and systems by scheduling ongoing routine maintenance and enforcing rules of occupancy (per location of each equipment) to minimize disruptions to business activities.
	Monitor and keep track of office supplies and consumables, maintain inventories of stock, placing order for replenishment when necessary.
	Select and manage relationships with suppliers (e.g. vendors of photocopy, or printing machines, power generating set) to ensure satisfactory standards of service and oversee their maintenance activities.


Bookkeeping and Accounting:


	Maintain accurate records of all cash requisitions, including supporting documentation from the requestor and make proper returns of cash obtained.
	Support bookkeeping and budgeting procedures for the company in respect of front office, office equipment and supplies expenditure.
	Assist in planning and monitoring office administration related expenditures.
	Develop and coordinate budgets for the office operation and associated accounts as appropriate.
	Maintain a balanced petty cash register.
	Receive and review petty cash requests from staff, verify the request is for a valid business expense and supported by appropriate documentation.
	Disburse the requested amount in cash, after verification and management approval and obtain a signed petty cash voucher from the requestor.
	Record each petty cash disbursement in a petty cash log, including the date, amount, purpose, and recipient of the funds with the supporting documentation, such as receipts or invoices, to the petty cash voucher.
	Reconcile entries to balance the petty cash account.
	Monitor office expenses and costs and keep updated records of office expenses and costs.
	Follow up on bills and payments associated with the office (Utility, Security)
	Comply with Company’s policies, review, and approval processes in making requests for reimbursement for petty cash and other major business expense cash requisitions (travels for staff etc).


Records Management:


	Manage emails, letters, packages, and other forms of correspondence in accordance with the mail management procedure.
	Create electronic copies and filing system for all physical incoming and outgoing correspondence by scanning and storing them in the appropriate folders on the Organization’s OneDrive folder, including tracking and locating missing documents.
	Handle and store surface mail securely to maintain the confidentiality of correspondence.
	Keep all records and files updated.


Others:


	Perform any other tasks as may be assigned.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, or a related field.
	At least 2 years of proven experience as office assistant, office administrator or in relevant position.
	Proficient in a variety of computer software applications including Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, Teams and Access).
	Familiarity with common procedures and basic bookkeeping and account principles used in the office.
	Customer Service Orientation/Client Focus (Internal and External).


Renumeration
N150,000 - N200,000 net per month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@wendernek.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email. 

 

2.) Operations Manager

Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	To lead and coordinate daily field and support operations across tank cleaning, inspection, and UWID operations, logistics, and back-office functions, ensuring maximum efficiency, safety, cost-effectiveness, and compliance with local and international regulations.
	The Operations Manager is accountable for achieving performance targets and operational integrity in alignment with company goals and client expectations.


Key Objectives:


	Ensure all field and support operations are executed efficiently, safely, and within budget.
	Drive process improvements across departments, including field service, logistics, QA/QC, and HSE.
	Support business growth through reliable operational delivery and client satisfaction.
	Build a strong organizational culture with a focus on performance, safety, and compliance.


Core Responsibilities
Field Operations Oversight:


	Manage field activities related to robotic tank cleaning, robotic tank inspection, ROV services, calibrations, ice blasting, and other service delivery.
	Supervise the execution of jobs, including equipment mobilization, personnel deployment, and project milestones.
	Ensure job readiness through pre-job checks, equipment testing, logistics coordination, and HSE risk assessments.


Workforce and Team Management:


	Lead and mentor multidisciplinary teams across operations, workshops, logistics, and administration.
	Supervise recruitment, onboarding, training, and performance reviews of operational staff.
	Define career paths and succession plans for key field and support roles.


Operational Planning and Optimization:


	Develop operational schedules, resource allocation plans, and project delivery strategies.
	Monitor performance KPIs such as job turnaround time, NPT (non-productive time), equipment utilization, and tool reliability.
	Implement lean and Six Sigma practices to eliminate inefficiencies and reduce operational waste.


Logistics and Supply Chain Coordination:


	Oversee base operations, equipment movement, inventory, and warehouse management.
	Coordinate material planning, vendor interaction, procurement schedules, and fleet utilization.
	Monitor spare parts availability, equipment downtime, and turnaround scheduling.


Financial Control and Budgeting:


	Develop and control operational budgets, including job costing, asset maintenance, and contractor services.
	Monitor actual vs forecasted cost performance and report variances to upper management.
	Review vendor pricing, service contracts, and procurement agreements to ensure cost efficiency.


Health Safety and Environmental (HSE) Compliance:


	Ensure compliance with HSE regulations (ISO, API, IADC, OSHA, local laws).
	Champion safety culture through toolbox talks, HSE campaigns, and incident investigations.
	Coordinate permit-to-work systems, safety audits, risk assessments, and training drills.


Client and Stakeholder Engagement:


	Liaise with client operations and project teams to align expectations and execution plans.
	Attend pre-job meetings, technical clarification sessions, and site inspections with clients.
	Resolve client concerns, operational issues, or service non-conformities with urgency and professionalism.


Quality and Reporting:


	Ensure QA/QC protocols are followed across equipment prep, inspection, and service delivery.
	Approve operational reports, daily field summaries, inventory logs, and incident logs.
	Maintain updated dashboards on operational metrics for leadership and client reporting.


Required Qualifications and Skills
Education:


	Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical, Petroleum, Industrial Engineering, or a related field
	MBA or PMP certification is an added advantage
	Minimum 7–10 years of experience in oilfield services or upstream operations, including tank cleaning, inspection, and calibrations.
	Minimum 3–5 years in a supervisory or management role with multi-site responsibility
	Strong background in tank cleaning, particularly automated or robotic, is an advantage.


Key Competencies:
Technical Competencies:


	Knowledge of tank cleaning, inspection, blasting, and calibration operations
	Proficient in ERP tools (SAP, Oracle) and digital field operations platforms
	Understanding of oil and gas compliance standards and industry best practices
	Strong command of inventory control, asset tracking, and logistics planning
	HSE front-line and barrier management skills


Tools & Systems Used:


	ERP systems (SAP, Oracle, or similar).
	Project management tools (Primavera, MS Project).
	BI tools (Power BI, Tableau).
	MS Office Suite (Excel, Word, Outlook).


Work Environment:


	Office-based with regular field visits to remote sites, bases, or client facilities
	Must be available for 24/7 operational escalation or emergency response when needed
	Exposure to high-risk environments with strict adherence to HSE standards.


Remuneration
N1,200,000 - N1,500,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should their CV / Resume to: recruitment@wendernek.com using the Job Position as the subject of email.

 

 

3.) Completion Sales Engineer

Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	To drive the sales and adoption of completion technologies and services by combining in-depth technical expertise with strategic customer engagement.
	The Completion Sales Engineer is a client-facing role responsible for identifying well completion requirements, developing customized solutions, preparing technical and commercial proposals, closing deals, and supporting project execution.

4.) Logistics-Based Manager

Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Logistics Manager is responsible for planning, organizing, and executing the movement, tracking, and documentation of equipment, materials, and personnel in support of our operations in the upstream, mid, and downstream oil and gas.
	The role ensures timely mobilization/demobilization of tools, compliance with regulatory requirements, and the coordination of land, sea, and air transport.
	This position plays a crucial part in minimizing non-productive time (NPT) and ensuring smooth operational continuity by aligning supply chain and field service requirements with logistics execution.


Key Responsibilities
Material and Equipment movement:


	Coordinate inbound and outbound shipments of oilfield tools, spare parts, consumables, and heavy equipment.
	Schedule and monitor deliveries via road, sea freight, and air freight, ensuring alignment with project timelines.
	Liaise with freight forwarders, haulers, rig/base personnel, and service companies for logistics planning.


Loadout and Backload Operations:


	Prepare loadout lists, packing lists, and cargo manifests for rig mobilization or job site support.
	Supervise backload returns, including inspection, documentation, and quarantine (if applicable).
	Ensure load compliance with lifting plans, weight limits, and HSE requirements.


Inventory and Material tracking:


	Track real-time location and status of tools and equipment through ERP or logistics software.
	Support inventory control teams with stock movements, bin transfers, and usage reporting.
	Maintain traceability of serialized equipment and rental assets.


Documentation and Customs Compliance:


	Generate shipping documentation: delivery notes, waybills, material transfer notes, manifests, and commercial invoices.
	Coordinate with customs brokers for import/export clearance in line with local regulations.
	Ensure adherence to documentation standards for bonded, non-bonded, and client-owned materials.


Vendor and Transport Coordination:


	Arrange trucking, vessel booking, and air cargo as per job urgency, tool availability, and route planning.
	Verify vendor compliance with HSE, transport, and documentation requirements.
	Coordinate return of rental tools and vendor-supplied equipment post-job.


HSE and Regulatory Compliance:


	Enforce load securing, safe lifting, and hazardous goods handling procedures.
	Ensure that logistics processes meet local, international, and company HSE standards.
	Participate in safety briefings, toolbox talks, and risk assessments related to transport or loading


Base/Yard Support:


	Coordinate with base teams for cargo preparation, staging, and dispatch.
	Ensure physical inspection of goods before shipment to confirm readiness and condition.
	Monitor yard layout efficiency for ease of loading/unloading and HSE adherence.


Communication and Stakeholder Liasion:


	Maintain constant communication with field service teams, workshop supervisors, and clients.
	Provide regular updates to operations and project managers on shipment status and ETAs.
	Act as a single point of contact for urgent dispatches, job mobilizations, and material logistics support.


Emergency and After-Hours Support:


	Be available for urgent call-outs, especially during operational downtime or high-priority jobs.
	Arrange express dispatches and last-minute freight bookings under pressure.


Requirements

	4–8 years of experience in logistics coordination, preferably in the oil and gas.
	Strong understanding of oilfield tools, consumables, and supply chain cycles.
	IATA/IMDG Certification for Dangerous Goods Handling
	Logistics/Supply Chain Certification (e.g., CILT, APICS, CSCMP)
	Forklift, Crane, or Lifting Certification (as applicable)

	Experience working with freight forwarders, customs agents, and bonded shipments.

	Knowledge of Incoterms, freight booking, and trade documentation
